content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Stone Furnace Facility at (0.0, 0.0)
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace at (0.0, 0.0) producing {'iron-plate': 43} (warning: no ingredients to smelt)  
– Iron Chest at (1.5, 0.5)  
Use-case: Primary smelting station for converting raw materials into iron plates.

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at (–16.0, –51.0)
Consists of:
– Burner Mining Drill at (–16.0, –51.0) (warnings: out of fuel, output blocked by item on the ground)  
– Burner Inserter at (–14.5, –49.5) (warning: out of fuel)  
– Iron Chest at (–13.5, –49.5) holding {'iron-ore': 146}  
– Burner Inserter at (–14.5, –47.5) (status: WAITING_FOR_SOURCE_ITEMS)  
– Fast Inserter at (–12.5, –49.5) (warning: not receiving electricity)  
– Fast Inserter at (–13.5, –45.5) (warning: not connected to power network)  
Use-case: Extraction and initial transport of iron ore for further processing.

### Copper Furnace at (–27.0, –60.0)
Consists of:
– Furnace at (–27.0, –60.0) now actively supplied with 20 units of copper ore and having produced 40 copper plates  
Use-case: Processes copper ore into copper plates for advanced manufacturing.

### Lab Power Integration System at (0.5, 2.5)
Consists of:
– Lab at (0.5, 2.5) with lab_input {'automation-science-pack': 23}  
– Offshore Pump at (–7.5, 25.5)  
– Offshore Pump at (–9.5, 24.5) (connected to the Boiler)  
– Boiler at (2.0, 17.5) now fueled with 10 coal (warnings: no input liquid, no fluid present in connections)  
– Steam Engine at (11.5, 27.5) (newly relocated; fluid connection via underground piping remains unresolved)  
Use-case: Supports lab operations through integrated power and fluid systems, though persistent fluid connectivity issues continue.

### Pipe Production Facility at (3.5, 0.5)
Consists of:
– Assembling Machine at (3.5, 0.5) reconfigured with a recipe for Copper Cable production (repeatedly failing to extract output)  
– Chest at (1.5, 0.5)  
– Distributed Small Electric Poles (placement conflicts observed near the assembling machine)  
Use-case: Originally designed for pipe production, it is now repurposed to manufacture copper cables for electronics; production issues persist due to power reception and extraction errors.

### Fluid Pipelines (Multiple Pipe Groups)
Consists of:
– Multiple PipeGroups spanning positions such as (–10.5, 22.5) to (–9.5, 23.5); groups at (8.5, 5.5), (10.5, 4.5), (–9.5, 24.5) to the Boiler, (2.5, 9.5), (10.5, 9.5), (1.5, 11.5), (–1.5, 17.5), (0.5, 17.5), (6.5, 16.5), (–1.5, 21.5) and (4.5, 25.5)  
Use-case: Transports fluids between production components; unresolved fluid connectivity persists between the Boiler and Steam Engine, exacerbated by congestion near (2.5, 21.5).

### Integrated Components
Consists of:
– BeltGroup connecting relevant inserter and belt outputs (6 belts total)  
– Electricity network via:
 • ElectricityGroup (id=57159) with poles at [(-10.5, -49.5), (-12.5, -48.5), (-12.5, -50.5)]  
 • ElectricityGroup (id=57162) near (3.5, 0.5)  
 • ElectricityGroup (id=57172) with poles at [(6.5, 3.5), (5.5, 8.5)]  
 • ElectricityGroup (id=57174) with poles at [(2.5, 30.5), (7.5, 26.5)]  
Use-case: Provides overall material handling via belts and supports factory operations with an extensive power network.

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
• Underground Fluid Connection Failures  
 – Multiple attempts to establish underground piping between the Boiler at (2.0, 17.5) and the Steam Engine at (11.5, 27.5) have failed—including two‐step connections via the calculated midpoint at (6.75, 22.5).  
 – Mitigation: Verify that both source and target connection points are unobstructed and capable of fluid transfer; adjust layout to reduce congestion and ensure matching fluid flow parameters.

• Offshore Pump and Electronic Component Crafting Failures  
 – Repeated errors occur when crafting Offshore Pumps and Electronic Circuits due to unmet sub-ingredient requirements (the inability to produce copper cables from copper plates prevents electronic-circuit fabrication).  
 – Mitigation: Ensure sufficient supply of upstream components such as copper plates and copper cables by optimizing production recipes and consolidating resource availability.

• Entity Placement and Collision Issues  
 – Failures during placement—such as errors when attempting to position an Offshore Pump or Small Electric Pole (e.g., near (5.5, 0.5))—result from tile occupation or insufficient spacing.  
 – Mitigation: Confirm that target tiles are free prior to placement and adjust spacing or placement direction to avoid collisions.

• Component Extraction Failures  
 – Persistent errors extracting copper cables from the assembling machine (at 3.5, 0.5) hinder production progression.  
 – Mitigation: Verify that the Assembling Machine has completed production and holds a valid entity for extraction before accessing its output.

• Fuel and Resource Insertion Issues  
 – Initial failures in inserting coal into the Boiler highlight inventory shortages; subsequent harvesting improved fuel levels but similar issues may recur.  
 – Mitigation: Proactively monitor and replenish essential resources to ensure smooth operation during supply insertion tasks.

• Removal Operation TypeError  
 – Previously, attempts to remove obstructing PipeGroups caused a TypeError by operating on a NoneType.  
 – Mitigation: Validate the existence and iterable nature of targeted entities before performing removal operations.

• Steam Engine Relocation Computation Error  
 – A TypeError was encountered during the computation of a new buildable area (treating a Position object as callable).  
 – Mitigation: Handle Position objects as data structures only; avoid invoking them as functions to correctly compute spatial parameters.
